metadata.title: CVE-2015-7835 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The mod_l2_entry function in arch/x86/mm.c in Xen 3.4 through 4.6.x doesnot properly validate level 2 page table entries, which allows local PVguest administrators to gain privileges via a crafted superpage mapping.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3').
